title: Swipes and Snoozes and Scheduling
text:
Updated Review:
I can now give 5  ‚≠êÔ∏è ‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è to Gmail! Not only can I now snooze emails AND customize swipes, but I can also schedule emails to be sent later! BOOM! üí£ Bravo üëèüèª 

My company uses Gmail and using this Gmail app for mobile really provides the tightest user experience over other mobile email apps. 
I really liked Google‚Äôs Inbox email app for mobile, but that‚Äôs being killed off soon, so I would LOVE it if the Gmail mobile team would take the snoozing design feature of Inbox and incorporate it into the Gmail app. 
With Inbox, I can bring up the snooze menu with a swipe, whereas in Gmail it takes 3 separate taps to bring up the snooze menu (1st world problem, I know). 
Speaking of swipes, why am I given only one option for swiping emails with the Gmail app: archive or delete? With Inbox I could swipe right to archive and swipe left to snooze. 
This Gmail app would receive a 4 stars if I could swipe to snooze, and 5 stars if I could swipe right to archive AND swipe left to snooze.

title: Lacks best feature of defunct Inbox
text:
The single thing I used/miss most of the Google Inbox app was the ability to write myself a note about next steps to take with an email right there under the subject line. It was a simple text box, and made email maintenance so much more efficient (currently, I have to write a note elsewhere and try to connect the email with it, or just try to remember what it was I was going to do with that email, both of which take way more mental energy than necessary). 
Please please please (!) re-introduce the reminder-text-box-under-subject-line that was so useful in Inbox and would make Gmail so much better! 

Worth two stars for how much it would boost my efficiency if it could be integrated with Calendar Reminders...

title: Please update this app
text: I‚Äôve used this app for years hoping that at some point with an update that one day you guys would put an option to select all messages so that you can delete everything you don‚Äôt want with the push of one button rather than having to individually click each email you don‚Äôt want. With the abundance of junk mail coming through the promotions and social emails it creates a lot clutter. In my case, after a couple of days I‚Äôll have 75 unread promotion emails and 50 social emails that I have to individually go down the list and select to be deleted instead of pressing one button to select all for a particular day then delete

title: Ads Have Gone Too Far üò°ü§¨
text:
I noticed an ad in my inbox today on the gmail app which was not in my same email‚Äôs inbox when I checked it on the apple mail app (proving this ad was native only to googles mail app)...there is no clear way to disable ads in my gmail app and furthermore it‚Äôs extremely disconcerting that this comes as a default setting in the first place. There are also only outdated articles online for how to disable ads showing up in my inbox and cluttering it. So infuriating and pointless. 

Btw, if you‚Äôre reading this google, please don‚Äôt respond to this review with some generic help message telling me you‚Äôre very sorry and to send an email to some support team...just fix it instead. Nobody likes ads cluttering their email inbox, especially those of us using the app as business professionals who manage multiple email accounts.

title: Annoyed
text: I have been using the gmail app on my Samsung for 7yrs which worked great, almost flawless. Switched over to iPhone a couple of months ago and as I‚Äôve always said, Google and Apple don‚Äôt like each other. First of all, you can‚Äôt customize the notification per each email so you know which address is receiving email like you can Samsung and second, after 5 email addresses added to the app it malfunctions, I‚Äôm an assistant for many people which means I have many email addresses I need to use for each client. Every couple of weeks the app will disable all of my emails together and I have to go back in and turn them all on. Not something I can have during a busy work week when I rely on my notifications....

title: DO NOT USE FOR BUSINESS OR FINANCIAL SITES
text: I have not received an email to one of my Gmail accounts linked to my PayPal since July 25th 2018. I have tirelessly tried getting this ridiculously inconvenient issue resolved. The ONLY way you'll ever get to talk to a person is if you are going to give them money (I.e. Adwords or Google Express) and they can't help you. I've even had one representive stay on the phone with me on  3 way to show them any options on the Google mail number they kept giving me will NEVER get you to a person. I have also sent electronic communication about this and still nothing. I've tried sending myself emails and they do not go through and say it will continue to attempt and still nothing. I would give negative stars if I could and will be switching my other accounts that still work over. From a VERY unhappy multiple business owner.

title: I used to like, but...
text:
I really liked this app. I felt it fetched my mail faster than my iPhone‚Äôs default app, and I like how it renders mail with graphics.

However, recently, Google has really been trying to push iPhone users to use the Chrome browser instead of Safari.  I have tried Chrome in the past and just did not want to use it on my device and uninstalled it. So, I un-toggled the ‚ÄúOpen with‚Äù button when asked if I wanted to open email links with Chrome.  But, each and every single time I clicked a link, it still asked me which browser I wanted to use, despite asking the Gmail app to NOT ask me about my browser again.

This happened every time, whether I had just updated the app or not. I understand that Google wants me to use their products (which I do, most of the time), but when you give me the option to choose my browser for the long term and I do, there is no reason to shamefully plug your other products. If I wanted to use Chrome, I would.

If I hear of Google fixing this issue, I will download the Gmail app again. However, I will not be using it for the time being. There‚Äôs no need to add an extra step every time I want to open a link.

userName: Ek is lief vie Willie Le Roux
title: Wish there were a few tweaks
text: Overall, I enjoy the app and it makes checking my gmail from my phone easy. I love that you can so easily switch between multiple accounts. There are just a few tweaks I wish they would make that make it more convenient and more identical to the computer version. My biggest annoyance with the app is probably that swiping an email in your inbox archives it, instead of something more practical like deleting it. I‚Äôve had to undo that so many times. I mean, where do archived emails even go?? Also, I wish they allowed you to mark emails as ‚ÄúImportant‚Äù the same way you can on a computer instead of just starring it.

title: Phone Links Won‚Äôt Work
text:
I often send/receive emails with links to open webpages, send emails, and make phone calls. When I use app with my iPhone, it wont make phone calls. It will open webpages and send emails - but will NOT make phone calls. This appears to be an app issue since using the same phone, the phone number link works fine when i skip the app and access my email directly from the browser. Same problem using the gmail app on multiple iPhones versions with different iOS versions. 

I tried removing the gmail account and deleting the app - than reinstalling but still have SAME PROBLEM

Google support says I need to ‚Äúallow permission‚Äù in phone, but there are no phone/microphone options related to the gmail app. 

It‚Äôs seems like gmail is standing at the door waiting to be let in, but they never bothered to knock and let Apple know they want access. 

I was hoping to rely soley on gmail for my email activity, but since my job now requires me to verify all links in our emails are functional prior to sending, I may have to rethink this one.

title: Needs better security features
text: I get spoofing happens to everyone but I have my email set to notify me whenever I get mail yet I was blissfully unaware that someone has been using my business email to register for various accounts and can somehow verify my email without me even knowing. This has been going on since august 8th. I would‚Äôve thought that you guys would‚Äôve had some sort of detection that can track the actual IP address and notify the owner of the account or at the very least, alert the account owner that there‚Äôs either unusual activity going on with their email address or notify them that their email address was used for a certain site in a certain location. I‚Äôd happily pay for an extra layer of security if provided.

title: Cannot Attach Documents From Google Drive
text: I love this app. Up until today it has worked without issue, but I needed to send an email with some attachments and every time I clicked on the attachment icon, it would pop up for a split second and then slip away. I first closed the app and that did not work, then I restarted my iPad, also did not work, and I finally deleted and re-downloaded the app and that did not seem to help either. I am not sure what else I can do to solve this problem. I also looked to see if my device was up to date with all the updates and it was. I would like some guidance if possible. Thank you.

title: Mark as unread is unreliable
text:
Gmail is great and this app is great. The bug issue is that the "mark as unread" button sometimes doesn't work! I get hundreds of emails and when there's something important I read on mobile and want to come back to it later I'll mark it as unread using the button in the top bar. About 50% of the time that doesn't work and I have to search for the email and then mark it as unread again.

Please fix this! Before I knew about this bug I ended up forgetting about some important emails - now I have to refresh my inbox every time I mark as unread just to make sure it's still there.

title: Dark Mode, Where Art Thou
text:
For those who don‚Äôt know, dark mode was supposedly enabled in Gmail on a rolling basis last fall, and some half a year later, many people still can‚Äôt use this functionality because of how Google pushes updates.

Even ignoring that, another example of how Gmail is held back due to various Google strategy taxes is how the company handles multiple accounts across all its services: the presumption that I want to use the same Google accounts in every Google app. My kingdom for a Google that would give me the opportunity to choose which Google accounts are accessible in every Google app.

As for the app‚Äôs basic functionality, if not for its support for push syncing, I can‚Äôt think of a single reason to prefer it to the built in mail app. And on an iPad, the web version makes for a better overall experience.

title: Lacks basic functionality, confusing UI
text:
I had to google ‚Äúmark all messages read in gmail ipad app‚Äù just to find out that I have to use a different app or open my gmail account in a browser to access that functionality - which has been available in every single mail client I‚Äôve *ever* used. But while I tapped around the entire UI for this app looking for ‚ÄúMark all as read‚Äù, I also discovered that they use non-standard icons for some things, unique wording in menus and features, and a forced organizational structure that doesn‚Äôt explain itself and is difficult to decipher on your own. 

I keep it installed just so I have a place to access my throw-away Gmail accounts without cluttering up my main mail app and iOS notifications, but I‚Äôd never use it for anything else.

title: Does as advertised, nice features for a free app
text:
Overall this is a very nice email app. Needs a better support and contact system for Google but everyone knows that. As I am legally blind I use this app for a multitude of thongs sich as job searching and etc. 

Does a great job of putting specific mail in specific folders when instructed. 

What would I change? Possibly a smart email filter to at least began removing junk, phishing, and useless emails from people with emails that are just wack. Only real complaint is I get about 2k spam emails daily and no way to filter them automatically. I have been using an alternate app to help filter these and just would be nice if could do it directly.

title: Beats mail
text: It took me a bit to get the hang of it, like tap the envelope of the Mail you're reading to mark it as unread. This still also beats mailbox, which would drive me  nuts. I agree with other users in that it does go back to your inbox way too quickly ‚Äì like if you click a link on the email and go back to the email within even like 30 seconds, you‚Äôve been taken back to the fall inbox and not the email you were just looking at, I really really really really really really really would love to be able to search in my trash or even just do a general search where it brings up something like ‚Äúdo you wanna look in trash for these messages as well?‚Äù

title: Terrible for IPad
text: On an Ipad, the customization features are horrible. I can‚Äôt open the app without it automatically opening an email. I‚Äôm not always going to sit and go through all the my emails till I clear my inbox. Some may sit there for a while until I can get to them depending on the project. I may open the app to write an email not just read them. The fact I can‚Äôt get the same view as I can on a regular browser or the mobile app is ridiculous. The app works great on a phone and the web application is excellent. This review is specific to ipad. I feel like the UI/UX is a massive shortfall. No app should ever dictate exactly how to interface with it. This isn‚Äôt tictok it‚Äôs a professional communication platform. (I pay for a workspace email) and it‚Äôs being treated like a ‚Äòstay and swipe‚Äô interface on Ipad.

title: Not a great product
text:
I moved to gmail from Yahoo because I want my email address to be portable if I change internet providers. I achieved that goal, but the user interface is not nearly as good as Yahoo. To trash a message takes three clicks on gmail. 1 on yahoo. The gmail has many labels , like important, archive, trash, junk, etc but there use is unclear. The Archive function was important in Yahoo but is hard to find in gmail, and I‚Äôm not sure what the rules are for archiving.  In Yahoo, the label tells clearly what will happen to the message. I have had a lot of trouble finding messages I‚Äôve either received it sent, after the initial read.
If you move to gmail, expect some issues.

title: Your 2factor authentication is infuriating.
text: I bought a new phone. All I wanted to do was sign into my account and you wouldn‚Äôt let me. You wouldn‚Äôt let me sign on either of my two Gmail accounts. So for two weeks while you‚Äôre trying to send stuff to the old phone, I‚Äôm sitting there with a new phone with the exact same number and I can‚Äôt verify crap. Because you‚Äôre still trying to send stuff to a phone that has been terminated. And I can‚Äôt change the type of phone that I have in your two factor authentication. I turned off the two factor authentication multiple times and you kept turning it back on. If you can‚Äôt make your it. I‚Äôve literally been on a new phone, with the same phone number, and you won‚Äôt let me sign in. I would give you zero stars if it would allow it.

title: Strange things are happening
text: I don‚Äôt receive notifications for my emails, and yes I have made sure they are turned on and I never turned them off. I have also made sure the ‚Äúpause notifications‚Äù feature is not turned on. I will be shown that I have emails, but there are none, I think it‚Äôs still showing emails I have deleted.  I will refresh the app and even go onto my other devices to make sure it‚Äôs all refreshed but it doesn‚Äôt change. So I have a constant red share with a number above my gmail app. I am now receiving multiple spam emails in my primary inbox from places like Costco, Ace, Walmart etc, which was never an issue in the past. I have uninstalled and reinstalled so many times and nothing changes.

title: Blocked to Infinity & Beyond
text: Anywhere in the possible near future will there be a feature to permanently block emails? Not the current block feature where the emails are moved to my spam folder where I can still stumble across negative energy emails that absolutely ruin my day and disrupt my peace. I mean like a, no and your access is denied to me blocked feature. This would be a great feature to have for stalkers and other unruly and unwanted emails from people who don‚Äôt get, leave me alone. Yahoo has this feature but I really want to rock with y‚Äôall (no shade to Yahoo!). Thanks!

title: Overall, nice email app...
text:
Overall, the functionality is nice. I like the layout and aesthetics. 

I was surprised at how far I had to dig for the simple task of adding or editing a (sub-)folder. 

Additionally, a plus side to the app is the ability to add multiple (non-)Google inboxes and have one app for all email. Love this feature. I did become quite annoyed when the app started incorrectly reporting the number of unread or outstanding emails with the badge icon. I had to verify on my laptop that I had either no emails in my inbox or all emails were read. I did this on my Gmail emails, Outlook email, and iCloud email. I keep my inboxes clean and I expect my apps to correctly report this too. I don't have time to be digging for a hidden unread email.

title: From Google Inbox to Gmail
text:
I‚Äôm a faithful Inbox user, and my favorite feature is the ability to create reminders and set them to repeat. Reminders integrated with email (that can be snoozed) is extremely powerful! I was sad to learn Inbox would be going away, and happy to learn gmail would include some of the Inbox features. So today, I learned snoozing was included as a gmail enhancement. While not perfect, I can email myself a reminder and snooze it. Not bad.

So why only a four star review? First, snooze is not fully functional yet. My repeat option is grayed out. Second, not all features of Inbox have made it to gmail. Once all is in place, then I will give five stars . :)

title: Favorite Email App but Snooze Feature Needs Updating
text:
Gmail is my favorite email application for sure - on desktop AND mobile. The handoff between both formats is impeccable. The ability to schedule and snooze emails is a life-saver. And the labeling system is bar none as well. 

My only complaint is that the Snooze feature doesn‚Äôt work well on Mobile. Emails persistently show back up in my inbox long before I have scheduled them to return. This is an incredibly frustrating glitch that I was hoping would be resolved with an update but it has been over six months and still has not been resolved.

title: Buggy?
text: I have several gmail accounts set up in this app and whenever I get mail, I get the notification bubble with the number of unread emails. Great! However, after I read all my new emails and mark them as read and go back to the home screen, the notification bubble doesn‚Äôt go away until I click through each one of my gmail accounts, even though I don‚Äôt have new email! It‚Äôs very annoying. If I get 3 new emails, the notification bubble stays at the number 3 even after I check my email, until I click through the inboxes for each of my gmail accounts, or if i get another email, then it will change to the number 1.  Seems bugged to me. Makes me want to just use the Apple Mail app instead.

title: Gmail to the rescue
text: As someone who was a victim of Yahoo!‚Äôs hack, my email address I‚Äôve had since my first computer ever, my original email address, has been rendered useless to me. Having heard from tech savvy people that Gmail was a great alternative, and ‚Äúsafer‚Äù (whatever they mean) than Yahoo!, I‚Äôve decided to go with it. So far, when I‚Äôve done research on my existing Gmail accounts, they pass the obvious security tests. I‚Äôm giving it 4 out of 5stars, not because of any dissatisfaction per se, just because as a LONG TIME user of Yahoo! Mail, the layout and feel of Gmail is different enough that it‚Äôs noticeable. Time will tell...

title: Still Jerky While Scrolling Emails with Images
text:
Gmail App still is struggles (very jerky) to scroll through an email with multiple images (inline images) or a single large image where as the same email forwarded to Outlook App just scrolls smoothly! 
Please fix the jerky scrolling email issue - have observed and tested a lot with multiple emails with heavy/large images! 

Update: Read same comments recently posted by others facing similar issue. Developers please fix! Also as suggested by developers, deleted and reinstalled the app - still the same scrolling issue!
Had issues on both iPhone 12 Pro Max and now on iPhone 13 Pro also with latest iOS 15.2 and latest gmail app!

title: Adding Meet is a Mistake
text:
I‚Äôm strictly here to offer my opinion about the new Meet tab at the bottom of the window. Gmail for mail remains fine. 

I only use Meet on my phone maybe once every two weeks or so. I do prefer it by far to Zoom or GoToMeeting, but it‚Äôs more usable and practical on my laptop, where I use it every day. 

Given that inserting Meet into Gmail is a deviation from the essential function of reading one‚Äôs mail, and the relative rarity of its use for which I can‚Äôt imagine I‚Äôm an uncommon use case, there‚Äôs no reason to have a tab for Meet always at the bottom of my emails list. If Google must insist this app is where the functionality must exist now, we should access it through a menu or other UI element, not give it significant, persistent real estate on the screen.

title: Dark Mode just doesn‚Äôt work
text: Despite being on the latest iOS, having system-wide dark mode turned on, and having the latest version of the Gmail app, dark mode just doesn‚Äôt work. When I load the app, the splash screen that shows the Gmail logo *does* have a dark background. But once it loads my emails, it‚Äôs just the plain old bright white. I‚Äôve checked in the settings within the app and there is no ‚ÄúTheme‚Äù option to be found, so that‚Äôs not it. I‚Äôve tried turning the system-wide dark mode off and then on again, force-quitting Gmail, turning the phone off and on again, etc. Nothing works. It‚Äôs very frustrating. I like the app otherwise, but the inability to have dark mode working is a big negative.

title: Photo access needs help.
text: I like the gmail app for iPhone for the most part. I especially like I can click on a link in any email and it will open in the chrome app. However my need for email is photo centric and the extremely limited access to photos is terribly. I am unable to send a short video at all. In addition I have thousands of photos on my phone so they are classified in different folders in my phone. The only pictures I can access are the ones by date. So if I was looking for something that was taken 9 months ago I would have to scroll back though all the photos since then. That‚Äôs just plain stupid. It‚Äôs even worse when I have to tell a client this app won‚Äôt let me access the photo so I‚Äôll change emails and send to you. Not worth the hassle.

title: App is not working
text: I can put in my email, but I cannot press the next button to continue on signing in. If the app has not been previously installed and not currently signed in to any emails, it will not let you sign in to the app because the next buttons are not working. I‚Äôve tried other apps that use Gmail like the Mail app for the iPhone and go through Gmail but the same problem occurs. For the Apple mail app I was able to press the next button but once I signed in the continue button didn‚Äôt work so I couldn‚Äôt get into the email. I found this problem on Google photos and the Gmail app. I find this very frustrating because I would like to use Gmail on my phone to look at work emails and also I need to access Google photos to submit photos for work.

title: Locked out of the new and updated gmail.
text: Finally got into my new and updated version of gmail. It needs a search for similiar emails, a simple click near the star opition click. It needs the delete click moved to the left, nearer the email choice click. Scrolling all over the screen to find similar emails and then delete those emails, which is the primary email function is not necessary. Gmail needs to block spammers and criminals totally from their system reducing everyones spam. Gmail is great, however, improvements are slow coming, like a turtle slow. However my Gmail is substantially better than my older Yahoo mail when it comes to Spammers.

title: You all must be bored
text: First of all I like gmail, I use for all kinds of stuff. What I don‚Äôt like is the amount of pointless promotional emails I get on every single account. Even from sites I subscribe too. When I use the ‚Äútell us why‚Äù it doesn‚Äôt matter how many times I answer. It does not change. A few days ago I signed on and all my gmail accounts were gone and AGAIN I had to reset the usage WHY???!!!! every time you do this you mess me up for days. I‚Äôm currently forced to use gmail for work and gmail is no longer making me happy as there are constant changes being made and it‚Äôs turning into a bit of a nuisance. You all don‚Äôt really seem to listen. Life needs to be a bit more simple as we are facing some pretty extreme days. So you have forced me to start deleting pieces of my google life so things can be easier. Thanks but no thanks.

title: I Love Gmail, but Please fix this!!!
text:
I Love Gmail! I use it for everything I do, business and personal. This app is no exception, it is near perfect for what I do.
I love everything about this app, but there is no,  ‚ÄúMobile signature before quoted text in replies and remove ‚Äú- -‚Äú line that precedes it.‚Äù,  feature! WHY? 
In business you want your clients to have immediate access to your contact information. They don‚Äôt need to be scrolling through dozens of emails in a thread to get to the stock pile of contact signatures at the bottom. This is just sloppy!!!
This is such a basic feature that your community has been begging you to fix for what seems like an eternity!   
üôèJust get it done already!!!

title: Great until
text: I have been using this app for years with no complaints.  Much preferred to the iPhone Mail app.  But just recently it stopped allowing me to login and I can‚Äôt fix it. I have uninstalled and reset my phone and reinstalled and tried to adjust security settings. All is fine with Gmail from my computer and I can login to other google apps. All I get when I try to open it is the Manage accounts page that won‚Äôt let me open any of the accounts and just lets me delete the account (which I did and re-installed) and when I click Done there it takes me to a ‚ÄúSomething went wrong‚Äù page and try again later.  Very frustrated!

title: Inferior to google Inbox
text:
I hate that I‚Äôm being forced to go back to an inferior email app. Inbox did such an amazing job of keeping my inbox clean, and prioritizing the emails that were important to me. Google claims all the best features of Inbox were moved to gmail but that‚Äôs absolutely not true. None of my bundles have carried over, and the process of trying to recreate them feels needlessly complicated compared to Inbox, and I don‚Äôt think I can set a label to turn off notifications for that label. I also can‚Äôt open attachments any more without opening the email first.  

If I could do everything in gmail that I could do in Inbox I would understand discontinuing the separate app, but that‚Äôs not the case. I can‚Äôt understand why google is killing the better product with more features.

title: Getting Better and Better
text:
I recently started using this app again. Had tried it in the past, but wasn‚Äôt happy enough with it to keep it until now. I love how easy it is to move to the next email and it‚Äôs just made so many improvements that I really don‚Äôt think I will be giving it up again. Thanks for working to make it better.

Update 3/6: Okay. I love it! I can swipe to new emails in unread with this latest update. I love being able to do so because in the past not being able to do so has made me dislike checking emails on an iPhone or iPad. Thanks for keeping it updated.

title: Gmail for iPad / iPhone  no ‚Äúfiles app‚Äù integration
text:
Updated 2022 july 
I use Gmail daily but it doesnt support ‚ÄúFiles app‚Äù  so I am forced to use the ‚ÄúMail app‚Äù for nearly every mail. 

Gmail does not support ‚ÄúFiles app‚Äù within iOS - it makes it very difficult to add multiple items from different services although items from Google Drive are accesable -  it is impossible to add from other areas within iOS. Considering that ios and files app has access to SMB drives, Files app, Dropbox, Onedrive etc. & Google drive 

Gmail only supporting drive - i loose access- to Files app this by itself is a shownstoper - It is damaging to workflows  -The lack of integration with ‚ÄúFiles app‚Äù leads me to not be able to use Gmail. 

Composing a mail as a draft is ok but for anything that is not on google drive its difficult. Ive found The work around -I must go back-and-forth between drafting in Gmail and finishing my drafts in the IOS Mail app 
On the plus side Gmail has far superior search capabilities and makes it very easy to find what I‚Äôm looking for. - honestly - I‚Äôd prefer to use Gmail but the lack of ability to add imagery or files from other areas  makes it almost impossible to use.

title: Notification red dot...
text: I use this app on my iPhone. It drives me CRAZY that after I check all my emails, the red notification dot stays there. I even close the app, reopen it, go to all my inboxes assuring there no unread emails, which there never is... then it ‚Äúmight‚Äù go away then. Other times it takes up to 10 minutes! I used to think it was crappy service (I have Sprint) but it does it at home using my WiFi also. Seems like a little thing but it seriously makes me want to pull my hair out. The other thing is when I get an email, I click on the banner notification and it just buffers. The email itself doesn‚Äôt show up for at least 5 minutes. On WiFi and the Sprint network. I open another app that uses the web, works great. It‚Äôs this app! I HATE IT!

title: Gmail
text: I‚Äôm going to tell the truth about this gmail app. I like this mail app, but the only thing is that I would like to be able to delete all of my unwanted emails at one time instead of having to pick each and every single email that you want to delete. If you would further fix this problem with the app I would like it even that much more. I‚Äôm using this app for my Dad‚Äôs account and he‚Äôs not really sure of how to use this email account and it is going to be very difficult for him to get used to. Please work on gettingSimplified

title: Getting worse with every update
text:
The latest update brings a new unwanted feature of notifying you of new emails in your Notification Center and then informing you of ‚Äúno connection‚Äù when you actually try to open new emails in app. Add this to the inability to copy text from an email and not being able to past a list of email addresses into the To field and have it format correctly, you have good reason to discontinue using this app and just sticking with Apples default email client which does all of this without issue.

Update: I am truly growing to HATE the gmail app. You can‚Äôt do basic things! You can‚Äôt tell where an email is because they entrucate them all in on string and it‚Äôs unidentifiable. I can‚Äôt even see the subject line. I, using apple mail now. Screw this!

title: Weird problems when replying to emails on iPhone
text:
In general, I really love Gmail! However, I have this weird problem that I can‚Äôt seem to find anyone else has. On my iPhone, when I am replying to an email, I will write a paragraph by using the microphone feature. And if I go back to edit it, the cursor gets moved to the end of the paragraph after the first character is corrected. It is so annoying. It takes forever to edit a paragraph that I have dictated into my phone.

I have looked all over the Internet and I can‚Äôt find out if anybody else has this problem. It would make this app so much better. Because I reply a lot on my phone to emails.

title: Stopped working after iOS 11 update
text: Now it just says ‚Äúno connection‚Äù even though I have WiFi and Cellular data enabled (and they are working fine for other apps). The weird thing is - notifications of new emails still come through to my phone, and I can open them as long as I do it right away. If I try to look at all my notifications of the last few days, the Gmail notifications I got over the last few days do not show up.  When I open the gmail app and look at my inbox - the only emails that show up are the ones that I opened when the notification came through, and it says ‚Äúno connection‚Äù at the bottom. It will not let me send any emails from my phone. When I look at my emails on my desktop computer, there are way more emails in my inbox than what is showing up on my phone.

title: Only use it for the labels
text:
This is the only app I‚Äôve found that supports Gmail‚Äôs labeling system, so this is what I use on my phone. There are so many things that I wish I did better - like scheduling emails, getting notified for important emails only, more customization, etc. 

But right now, the most *obnoxious* thing is that the notification bubbles don‚Äôt go away! I‚Äôll read all of my emails, sort them, and close out Gmail, and it‚Äôll still show the old number of unread emails for the next couple hours. It never clears out the notification bubble - it just updates the next time I get new emails. As someone who likes to clear out all of the badges numbers on my phone, it‚Äôs infuriating! 

I would switch clients in a heartbeat if they worked with Gmail‚Äôs labeling system.

title: ‚ÄúStorage Almost Full‚Äù Greedy Google
text:
I‚Äôve had this app and used Gmail for many years. This year, I continually get told by the application that my storage is almost full. I go in and clean out thousands of emails each month, even though they should be cleaning themselves out. I‚Äôve sent so many email senders to spam and have unsubscribed from so many senders, but the email application or Google continues to allow this. I will unsubscribe from mini sunders, and it will stop for a while and then they will start up again.
I have tried to re-install uninstall, and do everything that I possibly could to see if it was an application issue, but I believe that this is School‚Äôs way of being greedy, and they just want people to pay for extra storage. Absolutely horrible.

title: Missing one key feature
text: I got this app to replace the iPhone Mail app for my main Gmail account (since the Mail app‚Äôs search functionality is completely dysfunctional), and this app worked fine until the number of unread emails inevitably stacked up and I just needed to mark everything as ‚Äúread‚Äù - which, it turns out, you can‚Äôt do in the app. This is one of the most basic features of an e-mail application so it was hugely surprising to me that Google requires you to log onto the computer to make that annoying red bubble on your phone‚Äôs home page go away. Anyway it‚Äôs sad that the lack of one absolutely basic feature renders the app so much less useful, but this one definitely does. Do better Google.

title: Used to be a much better app
text:
The official Gmail app used to be one of the nest you could possibly use. Then the pandemic hit, Google decided to clutter it up with Google Meet, and it‚Äôs been downhill since then. 

The switch between Mail and Meet is clumsy and easy to activate without intending to. And in recent versions, the message window doesn‚Äôt load properly, leaving users to see only a portion of the message. Sometimes you end up with a full screen message view instead. There‚Äôs no way to fix either problem except to force quit the app and start over again, which is just madness.

Others have noted the lack of basic editing functions like formatting text or even embedding a link rather than having to include it separately as part of the text, which is ugly and frustrating.

Google offers no way for customers to provide feedback, but even so, one wonders if no one at Google actually uses this app. It‚Äôs the only explanation for why these issues are allowed to persist, but it certainly is not a satisfactory one.

title: Gmail App Suggestions
text:
The Gmail app is pretty good, I don't have any issues with it.  I do however have a few suggestions that could make it better.

1) On the iPad version, can you make it so that all folders (not just Primary, Social, Promotions, etc. but also Starred, Snoozed, Important, Sent, Spam, Trash and so on) can be displayed in the left most navigation column under the hamburger menu?  Therefore, if I wanted to see all of my starred or important email messages, I could do so without having to click on the hamburger icon.

2) I think it would be a great idea if there is an Archived folder so I don't have to go into All Mail to access my archived messages.

3) When sending attachments through the app, can you include support for attaching files from drives other than Google Drive (such as OneDrive, Dropbox, Adobe Document Cloud, iCloud Drive, etc.)?  Currently, when sending Word documents saved in OneDrive on my iPhone or iPad, I have to do so through the native iOS mail app because Gmail can only attach files saved in Google Drive.

title: Great app crippling flaw
text: I love the gmail app for very obvious reasons and I definitely favor it over the apple version of a mail app.  Only one major problem here is i can not see my text when replying to an email... yea even changing the theme did not seem to work so i went and looked for answers online and i am definitely not the only one having this issue so it does make me feel a little better that this problem is not exclusive to me.  Still not enough to call it a terrible app because its far from that but enough for me to not be able to use it on my phone which is the computer i have on me 100% of the time so please fix this.

title: 2 Stars for Okay
text: I previously used Inbox for Gmail which was by far my favorite. Now that its been discontinued or no longer supported whatever I am forced to use this now. Don‚Äôt get me wrong I like the app‚Äôs interface and gestures also the predictive text thing it does too when typing out an email. Even the separate folders. The main reason for the 3 stars this app desperately needs a delete all function the selecting one email at a time to delete is time consuming and in my words just plain ridiculous. I don‚Äôt want to spend 15-30 minutes clearing out junk, spam, promotions or social. I am person that likes to keep my devices minimal. So until the delete all function is added I‚Äôll keep this at 2 stars. Other than that no other problems.
